reports.title: Age Distribution by Business Unit
reports.query:
MATCH (e:Employee)-[:WORKS_IN]->(b:BusinessUnit)
WITH b,e, 
  CASE
    WHEN e.age >= 20 AND e.age < 30 THEN '20-29'
    WHEN e.age >= 30 AND e.age < 40 THEN '30-39'
    WHEN e.age >= 40 AND e.age < 50 THEN '40-49'
    WHEN e.age >= 50 AND e.age < 66 THEN '50-66'
    ELSE '66+'
  END AS ageGroup, COUNT(e) AS employeeCount

WITH  b, ageGroup, employeeCount,
  REDUCE(s = 0, x IN COLLECT(employeeCount) | s + x) AS totalEmployees

WITH  b.unit_name AS state, ageGroup, employeeCount * 100.0 / totalEmployees AS percentage

RETURN [state, ageGroup] AS path, percentage AS value

reports.title: Employee Count by Department
reports.query:
MATCH (e:Employee)-[:BELONGS_TO]->(d:Department)
RETURN d.department_name AS department, COUNT(e) AS employee_count

reports.title: Age Distribution by Education Level
reports.query:
MATCH (e:Employee)-[:HAS_EDUCATION]->(ed:Education)
WITH e, ed.level AS level
WHERE level = $neodash_education_level
WITH e,
  CASE
    WHEN e.age >= 20 AND e.age < 30 THEN '20-29'
    WHEN e.age >= 30 AND e.age < 40 THEN '30-39'
    WHEN e.age >= 40 AND e.age < 50 THEN '40-49'
    WHEN e.age >= 50 AND e.age < 66 THEN '50-66'
    ELSE '65+'
  END AS age_group

RETURN age_group, COUNT(e) AS employee_count;

reports.title: Average Salary by Gender
reports.query:
MATCH (e:Employee)-[hasJob:HAS_JOB]->(j:Job)
WITH e.gender AS gender, hasJob.salary AS salary
WHERE gender IS NOT NULL
RETURN gender, round(AVG(salary),3) AS averageSalary
ORDER BY averageSalary DESC;

reports.title: Marital Status Distribution
reports.query:
MATCH (m:MaritalStatus)<-[:HAS_MARITAL_STATUS]-(e:Employee)
RETURN m.status AS marital_status, COUNT(e) AS employee_count

reports.title: Job Classification Distribution
reports.query:
MATCH (j:Job)<-[:HAS_JOB]-(e:Employee)
WITH j.job_classification AS job_classification
RETURN job_classification, COUNT(*) AS count

reports.title: Employees by Business Unit, Education Level, Age
reports.query:
MATCH (b:BusinessUnit)<-[bu:WORKS_IN]-(e:Employee)-[h:HAS_EDUCATION]->(ed:Education)
WHERE b.unit_name = $neodash_businessunit_unit_name
      AND e.emp_type = 'Active' 
      AND e.age > $neodash_employee_age_min
      AND e.age < $neodash_employee_age_max
      AND ed.level = $neodash_education_level
WITH e, h, ed, bu, b
RETURN e, h, ed, bu, b

reports.title: Employee Salary Analysis by Education Level
Select Max Age
reports.query:
MATCH (n:`Employee`) 
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`age`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`age` as value,  n.`age` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

reports.title: Select Min Age
reports.query:
MATCH (n:`Employee`) 
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`age`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`age` as value,  n.`age` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

reports.title: Select Performance Rating
reports.query:
MATCH (n:`BusinessUnit`) 
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`unit_name`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`unit_name` as value,  n.`unit_name` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

reports.title: Select Education Level
reports.query:
MATCH (n:`Education`) 
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`level`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`level` as value,  n.`level` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

reports.title: TOP 5 Departments with Percentage of Female Employees and Their salaries
reports.query:
MATCH (e:Employee { gender: 'Female' })-[:BELONGS_TO]->(d:Department)
WITH d, COUNT(e) AS female_count
MATCH (e:Employee)-[:BELONGS_TO]->(d)
WITH d, female_count, COUNT(e) AS total_count
WITH d, female_count, total_count, round(female_count * 100.0 / total_count,3) AS female_percentage
WHERE female_percentage IS NOT NULL
WITH d, female_percentage
ORDER BY female_percentage DESC
LIMIT 5
MATCH (e:Employee { gender: 'Female' })-[:BELONGS_TO]->(topD:Department { department_name: d.department_name })
MATCH (e:Employee)-[h:HAS_JOB]->(j:Job)
RETURN topD.department_name AS department, female_percentage AS percentage, 
      round( AVG(h.salary),3) AS avg_female_salary
ORDER BY female_percentage DESC;

reports.title: Performance Overview for Top 5 Highest Salary Employees
reports.query:
MATCH (e:Employee)-[:HAS_PERFORMANCE]->(p:Performance) 
MATCH (e)-[r:HAS_JOB]->(j:Job) 
WITH e, p, toFloat(r.salary) AS Salary 
ORDER BY Salary DESC 
LIMIT 5 
RETURN e.last_name as Employee, 
       Salary, 
       CASE p.job_involvement WHEN 'Very High' THEN 100 

                             WHEN 'High' THEN 80 

                             WHEN 'Medium' THEN 60 

                             WHEN 'Low' THEN 40 

                             ELSE 0 END as JobInvolvement, 

       CASE p.job_satisfaction WHEN 'Very High' THEN 100 

                              WHEN 'High' THEN 80 

                              WHEN 'Medium' THEN 60 

                              WHEN 'Low' THEN 40 

                              ELSE 0 END as JobSatisfaction, 

       CASE p.performance_rating WHEN 'Outstanding' THEN 100 

                                 WHEN 'Excellent' THEN 80 

                                 WHEN 'Good' THEN 60 

                                 WHEN 'Low' THEN 40 

                                 ELSE 0 END as PerformanceRating, 

       CASE p.relationship_satisfaction WHEN 'Very High' THEN 100 

                                       WHEN 'High' THEN 80 

                                       WHEN 'Medium' THEN 60 

                                       WHEN 'Low' THEN 40 

                                       ELSE 0 END as RelationshipSatisfaction, 

       CASE p.worklife_balance WHEN 'Very High' THEN 100 

                              WHEN 'High' THEN 80 

                              WHEN 'Medium' THEN 60 

                              WHEN 'Low' THEN 40 

                              ELSE 0 END as WorkLifeBalance

reports.title: Employee Performance Ratings Overview
reports.query:
MATCH (p:Performance)<-[:HAS_PERFORMANCE]-(e:Employee) 
RETURN p.performance_rating AS performance_rating, COUNT(e) AS employee_count

reports.title: Average Years in Current Role by Department
reports.query:
MATCH (d:Department)<-[:BELONGS_TO]-(e:Employee)-[:HAS_EXPERIENCE]->(r:Experience)
WITH d, avg(toInteger(SPLIT(r.years_in_current_role, ' ')[0])) AS avg_years
RETURN d.department_name AS department, avg_years
ORDER BY department

reports.title: Education Level and Performance
reports.query:
MATCH (e:Employee)-[:HAS_EDUCATION]->(ed:Education)
MATCH (e)-[:HAS_PERFORMANCE]->(p:Performance)
WITH ed.level AS education_level, 
     CASE p.performance_rating
       WHEN 'Low' THEN 1
       WHEN 'Medium' THEN 2
       WHEN 'High' THEN 3
       WHEN 'Outstanding' THEN 4
       ELSE 0 
     END AS numeric_performance
RETURN education_level, ROUND(AVG(numeric_performance),4) AS avg_performance;

reports.title: Marital Status Impact on Promotions
reports.query:
MATCH (r:Experience)<-[:HAS_EXPERIENCE]-(e:Employee)-[:HAS_MARITAL_STATUS]->(m:MaritalStatus)
WITH m.status AS maritalStatus, ROUND(AVG(toInteger(SPLIT(r.years_since_last_promotion, ' ')[0])),3) AS avgYearsSinceLastPromotion
RETURN maritalStatus, avgYearsSinceLastPromotion
ORDER BY avgYearsSinceLastPromotion DESC;

reports.title: Average Years Since Last Promotion by Department
reports.query:
MATCH (d:Department)<-[:BELONGS_TO]-(e:Employee)-[:HAS_EXPERIENCE]->(r:Experience)
WITH d, avg(toInteger(SPLIT(r.years_since_last_promotion, ' ')[0])) AS avg_years
RETURN d.department_name AS department, avg_years
ORDER BY department

reports.title: Average Sick Days by Job Type, Marital Status, Department
reports.query:
MATCH (e:Employee)-[:HAS_LEAVE]->(l:Leave)
MATCH (e)-[:HAS_MARITAL_STATUS]->(m:MaritalStatus)
MATCH (e)-[:HAS_JOB]->(j:Job)
MATCH (e)-[:BELONGS_TO]->(d:Department)
WITH 
     m.status as stat,
     j.job_type AS jobType, 
     d.department_name AS depname, 
     ROUND(AVG(l.sick_days), 3) AS avgSickDays

RETURN [jobType, stat, depname] as path, [avgSickDays] as val

reports.title: Total Sick Leave Based on Balance Days
reports.query:
MATCH (m:MaritalStatus)<-[:HAS_MARITAL_STATUS]-(e:Employee)-[:HAS_LEAVE]->(l:Leave)
WITH m.status AS marital_status, SUM(l.balance_days) AS total_balance_days
RETURN marital_status, total_balance_days
ORDER BY total_balance_days DESC;

reports.title: Number of Employees Hired Each Year
reports.query:
MATCH (e:Employee)-[h:HAS_JOB]->(:Job)
WITH e, h.hire_date.year as hireYear
RETURN hireYear, COUNT(e) AS numberOfEmployees
ORDER BY hireYear

reports.title: Top 5 Departments with the Highest Number of Hires in the Last 10 Years
reports.query:
MATCH (d:Department)<-[:BELONGS_TO]-(e:Employee)-[h:HAS_JOB]->(j:Job)
WHERE h.hire_date.year >= date().year - 10
WITH d, COUNT(e) AS numberOfHires, 
      AVG(e.age) AS averageAge, 
      MAX(h.salary) AS maxSalary
RETURN d.department_name AS departmentName, numberOfHires, averageAge, maxSalary
ORDER BY numberOfHires DESC
LIMIT 5
